Executive Summary
FLO GROUP is a leading company in the footwear market in Turkey, operating in more than
25 countries, the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS), the Middle East and North
Africa regions with more than 800 stores. With a multi-channel business model, FLO GROUP
reaches millions of customers both in Turkey and abroad through its retail stores, e-
commerce platforms and wholesale network. In addition, it strengthens its sales network
with local and international brands every year.
When I started my internship, my expectations were to learn about the footwear industry,
get to know the departments and observe the projects. I had the opportunity to experience
all of these expectations during my internship. Detailed information was provided about
many departments and the projects they worked on were explained. I developed a
comprehensive understanding of the functioning of each of them by receiving various
trainings, especially in the logistics, marketing, product management and e-commerce
departments.
Among the important activities of my internship were data analysis studies to increase sales
performance in the e-commerce department. During this process, I collected sales data,
made analyzes using tools such as Power BI and made strategic recommendations. I also had
the opportunity to work on product selection and supplier management in the Accessories
and Category Management department. I contributed to inventory management processes
by determining the demand levels of products.
My expectations from the internship were to apply my theoretical knowledge in practice and
observe real business processes in the sector. The results that were realized were in line
with these expectations. I had the opportunity to interact with different departments and
learn about many projects. These experiences prepared an important ground for my career
goals.
What I learned the most during this process was the role of the analytical and systematic
approach of Industrial Engineering in improving business processes. Understanding the
functioning of different departments and the ways each of them achieved their own goals
allowed me to understand the importance of teamwork. The knowledge and experiences I
gained during my internship provided a solid foundation for advancing my career and
motivated me to take a more active role in future projects.

1. Company and Sector
a. Overview of the Company and Sector
Company Name Flo Mağazacılık ve Pazarlama A.Ş.

Figure1 : Flo Group Logo
FLO Group is a leading retail company in the shoe sector with its 65-year history, 15,000
direct and 70,000 indirect employments in 25 countries on 3 continents. Thanks to its multi-
channel retail approach, FLO, which sells 55 million pairs of shoes per year, is a well-known
brand in Turkey and operates with chain stores such as IN STREET.
The company operates as a monobrand store with brands such as Reebok, Nine West and
Lumberjack, while it is also known for brands such as Kinetix and Polaris. The Design Center,
established in 2014, plays an important role in R&D and collection creation processes.
FLO Group aims to increase speed and efficiency in its operations with the technology
company it established in 2023 and establishes Solar Power Plants for environmental
sustainability. In addition, it contributes to local development projects by creating
employment opportunities for young people and women.
4

b. Organization of the Company
These departments consist of professionals specialized in different fields to achieve
FLO Group's overall goals.
Figure 2 : Flo Organization Chart
5

c. Production/Service System
FLO Group's production/service system has an integrated structure with the omni-
channel retail approach. This system is shaped by the dynamic relationships between
the main comp

onents: marketing, production, finance, purchasing and sales. Below is
a chart showing the relationships between these components:
Figure 3 : Flo Group’s Component and Description Table
Production Process: When we consider shoes as the main product, the production
process starts with customer needs analysis, then the marketing strategy is developed.
The design process and prototype production are followed. After the production
planning is made, material purchasing processes are carried out. The production
process continues with quality control, then distribution and logistics. Finally,
customer feedback is received by reaching the sales channels.
Productive and Non-Productive Elements: While customer needs analysis, production
process and quality control are among the productive elements; feedback process and
marketing strategy development are considered as non-productive elements.
Performance Description: FLO Group's production/service system is designed to
respond quickly to market dynamics. While production efficiency is ensured with an
annual production capacity of 3 million pairs, quality is guaranteed by tests carried
out in internationally accredited laboratories. Fast distribution is provided with
advanced logistics processes.
Planning, Forecasting, Inventory and Logistics Activities: Planning is done with
detailed annual and monthly plans to achieve production and sales targets. Demand
forecasts are carried out with market research and historical sales data. While
inventory management is continuously monitored and optimized, logistics processes
are effectively managed to ensure that products are at the right time and in the right
place.
This integrated approach allows FLO Group to be managed effectively by prioritizing
customer satisfaction.
6

d. Professio

nal and Ethical Responsibilities of Engineers
At FLO Group, industrial engineers perform important functions to increase the company's
efficiency and optimize its processes. These functions include tasks such as process analysis
and improvement, data analysis, project management, resource planning, supply chain
management, quality management, and training and development. In addition, industrial
engineers also take active roles in different departments such as marketing, sales, finance,
and production, working to improve various processes and increase efficiency.
The professional and ethical responsibilities of industrial engineers are shaped within the
framework of business ethics and professional standards. In this context, they have
important responsibilities such as adhering to the principles of honesty and transparency,
ensuring continuous development, having a sense of social responsibility, complying with
confidentiality rules, and ensuring justice and equality.
FLO Group determines its professional and ethical standards in line with company policies
and international engineering standards. ISO certificates and the ethical rules of engineering
associations in Turkey form the basis of these standards. In addition, the ethical and
behavior code that FLO Group has created for its employees clearly determines workplace
behaviors and professional responsibilities. This code includes core values such as justice,
honesty, confidentiality, and professionalism.
During my internship, I had the opportunity to observe the role of industrial engineers in
projects. I saw that they developed innovative solutions in line with the goals of reducing
costs and increasing efficiency in supply chain management processes. I also noticed that
they were also involved in marketing and sa

les departments, performing data analysis on
topics such as customer segmentation and sales strategies. I also observed that industrial
engineers aimed to increase the knowledge of other department employees by providing
process improvement training.
The transparency and honesty of industrial engineers in projects contributes to the more
efficient business processes by creating trust within the team. Therefore, always keeping
professional and ethical responsibilities at the forefront is critical to the success of both FLO
Group and the engineers.
7

Summer Practice Description
2.
During my summer internship, I gained a versatile experience by working in various
departments. During my internship, I played an active role in departments such as logistics,
marketing, performance analysis, category management and internal audit. The experiences
I gained during this process provided great gains both professionally and technically. I took on
many tasks directly related to the discipline of industrial engineering in particular and had the
opportunity to apply theoretical knowledge. Now, I will share these experiences by detailing
the activities I carried out during my internship day by day.
The first day of my internship started with an orientation where we were informed about the
general structure of FLO Group and the internship process. Recruitment and Career Group
Manager Pınar Sancaklı made a detailed presentation about the company's history, vision,
mission and working principles. In this presentation, I learned about FLO Group's position in
the retail sector and its future goals. During this process, I had the chance to understand the
strategic role of industrial engineers in the company. In particular, the contributions of
industrial engineers to process optimization in production, logistics and supply chain
management were emphasized. We were welcomed very warmly as interns and thanks to
this, my adaptation process was quite easy.
Figure 4: Structures located within the Flo Group
On the third day of my internship, we received comprehensive training in the logistics
department. In this training, it was explained in detail how domestic and international product
flows are organized and how logistics processes are plan

ned. I learned how data is analyzed
through systems such as SAP, NOVA and Power BI used in the logistics department. I observed
how these systems are effectively used in process improvement and efficiency increase, which
are important areas of industrial engineering. In addition, we conducted performance
analyses using KPIs (key performance indicators) in these processes and examined the effects
of these analyses on decision-making processes in logistics.
8

Figure 4: Flo Group domestic and international logistics network
On the fourth day, we focused on the IN STREET brand within the FLO Group. We analyzed
the work carried out to achieve the brand's goals. In this context, we evaluated the positions
of rival brands in the market by conducting competitive analyses and learned how these
analyses played a role in IN STREET's strategic decision-making processes. I had the
opportunity to observe the importance of digitalization in the retail sector and the
contribution of analyses conducted with digital tools to brand strategies. It was quite
interesting to see how marketing and retail strategies were handled from an industrial
engineering perspective.
On the fifth day, we focused on the activities of the Marketing and Growth Directorate. We
examined how brands' strategic communication plans are created and how budget
management is done in this process. I learned how budgets are optimized during campaign
periods and which marketing strategies are used. When I look from an industrial engineering
perspective, I realized how important data analysis and performance tracking are in the
strategic decision-making process in marketing processes. This was one of the elements that
increased the effectiveness of optimization studies on customer segmentation and reaching
the target audience.
9

Today, I received important training on category management. I learned how to create a
collection according to product and customer demands and how to manage the supply chain
in this process. I worked with tools such as stock options and range plans used to measure
stock performance and optimize product selection. During this process, I observed how
complex and detailed analysis is required to select the most suitable products for customer
needs. I did a study on Affiliate Marketing. In particular, stock management and effective
analysis of sales performance were very important issues in terms of industrial engineering
discipline.
Figure 5: An example of an affiliate marketing study
On the 11th day of my internship, I worked on seasonal sales tracking. We analyzed how
sales performance is tracked and the effects of this performance on inventory management.
I gained in-depth knowledge on how seasonal fluctuations are managed and how sales
forecasts are made from an industrial engineering perspective. The software and analysis
tools used in this process played a major role in developing sales strategies.
Figure 6: Comparison of Sales in Turkey and Abroad
10

On the 17th day, I attended a presentation at the Internal Audit Directorate. I learned how
internal audit controls the accuracy and efficiency of processes within the company and how
it deals with risk management and control processes. I also saw how internal audit processes
are linked to process optimization and efficiency analyses from an industrial engineering
perspective. These processes were of great importance in achieving the company's strategic
goals.
Figure 6: The Risk Assessment Scale
In general, I had the opportunity to see many different departments and participate in
various activities during my internship. The experiences I gained in areas such as logistics,
category management, marketing and internal audit provided me with the opportunity to
apply my theoretical knowledge. From an industrial engineering perspective, I gained
significant gains in process improvement, efficiency increase, data analysis and strategic
decision making. It was very useful to see FLO Group's large-scale operations in the retail
sector and to closely observe the role of industrial engineers in these processes.
The working environment of a large company like FLO Group had a collaborative and
dynamic structure. I observed that industrial engineers worked in many different
departments. These engineers played a critical role in the efficient progress of processes and
the achievement of strategic goals. The technologies and software used in the company
contributed to the acceleration of business processes and making them more efficient.
11

If we evaluate the current status and future of the sector; it is possible to say that
technology and digitalization are becoming increasingly important in the retail sector.
Technologies such as 3D printers, big data analytics, artificial intelligence and IoT can
radically change production processes and customer experience in the coming years. These
technologies have great potential, especially in areas such as personalized products and
rapid prototyping. I also foresee that the sector will develop itself by using more innovative
technologies in terms of environmental sustainability and reducing carbon footprint.
As a result, my internship process provided me with significant gains both professionally and
technically. I had the opportunity to observe the wide-ranging effects of the industrial
engineering discipline in the retail sector, and these experiences formed a solid foundation
for my career.
• Activity Analysis
An important Industrial Engineering activity that I observed during my internship was an
analysis study conducted to improve the sales performance of the e-commerce platform.
This study included both data analysis and strategic decision-making processes, and I had
the opportunity to apply the information I learned during my internship. A study was
conducted in the e-commerce department in order to analyze the performance of products
by examining sales data for a certain period of time. This study covered the collection,
analysis and reporting of sales data separated by product categories. Firstly, sales data were
collected from various sources; these data included periodic sales figures, customer
feedback and inventory levels.
Figure 7: Audience overview example
12

After the data collection process, visualization tools such as Power BI were used for
the analysis of the data. Thanks to these tools, we have made it more understandable by
visualizing sales trends, best-selling products and customer preferences. In the light of
the obtained data, strategic recommendations were made by determining which
products received more attention and which categories remained weak.
At this event, some important performance indicators and metrics used to evaluate sales
performance were as follows:
Sales Volume: The number of products sold in a certain period of time (for example,
monthly or yearly). This indicator is critical for understanding increases or decreases
in certain product groups, as well as overall performance.
Conversion Rate: A rate that shows how many of the users who visit the website have
made a purchase. This ratio is important for evaluating the effectiveness of marketing
strategies.
Average Order Value (AOV): Determines the average purchase amount made by a
customer. This indicator is used to analyze the impact of the work done to increase
customer spending.
Inventory Turnover Rate: It is a criterion that shows how long it took for stocks to be
sold. It helps to identify slow-moving products.
Figure 7: Flo Group in E-commerce
13

Some problems that arose during the data analysis helped us to better understand the
current situation. Firstly, in the analyses, it was seen that although some products were
in high demand, the stock levels remained insufficient. This situation leads to lost sales
opportunities and negatively affects customer satisfaction. In addition, it was
determined that the conversion rate among website visitors was low. Dec, this may be
due to problems that may be related to the user experience. It was concluded that the
site design, navigation or paying processes should be reviewed. Finally, the analysis
results showed that certain product categories have not kept up with Sunday trends. It
was noticed that it was insufficient to respond to the new fashion trends. This situation
increases the risk of losing the competitive advantage.
This event was an im

portant step in improving the sales performance in the e-commerce
sector. The results of the analysis made a great contribution to shaping the strategic
decisions of the department. Such studies conducted based on data have once again
shown the importance of the systematic approach and analytical thinking provided by
the discipline of Industrial Engineering. Taking part in such events during my
internship made a great contribution to my professional development and allowed me
to gain important information for my future career goals.
14

3. Conclusions
If I summarize the activities I carried out during my internship; I worked in various
departments such as logistics, marketing, performance analysis, category
management and internal audit. During this period, I gained in-depth knowledge
about stock management, product planning, sales performance analysis and supply
chain processes. I also worked on how business processes are optimized with ERP and
SAP systems. I gained experience in category management in terms of creating
collections in line with product and customer demands and developing marketing
strategies.
Thanks to these activities, I learned how operational processes work and how each
department contributes to these processes. At the same time, I developed my skills
in using software and systems that play important roles in data analysis, planning and
strategic decision-making processes. I gained experience in increasing the efficiency
of processes, especially by using SAP and ERP systems. In addition, I learned to use
marketing analysis tools such as customer segmentation and sales performance
monitoring effectively.
In terms of professional and technical experience, I gained significant gains in data-
driven decision-making, teamwork, supply chain optimization and project
management. The industrial engineers I observed were working in many different
departments such as production, marketing, purchasing and logistics and playing key
roles in these processes. The versatile skills of the engineers contributed to the
smooth flow of workflows and rapid decision-making. The work environment was
generally dynamic, collaborative and innovative; communication between
departments was strong and it was motivating to see everyone working towards a
common goal.
When I examined the status of the sector, I observed that digitalization was rapidly
increasing in large companies such as FLO Group and investments in technology were
gaining importance. ERP systems are of critical importance in supply chain
management. However, one of the most important challenges for companies
operating in a large sector is to keep up with rapidly changing consumer demands and
technological developments. The market size and number of employees are
increasing every year, but this also brings new challenges in terms of cost and
efficiency.
I predict that there will be some major changes in the shoe and fashion retail sector
in the next 5-10 years. With the widespread use of 3D printers, there may be
revolutionary developments in areas such as rapid prototyping of products and even
direct-to-consumer customization. Big data analytics and artificial intelligence will
allow for more accurate forecasting of customer demands and more efficient
inventory management. In addition, thanks to the Internet of Things (IoT) technology,
tracking of products in stores can become smarter and real-time inventory
management can be possible. In terms of environmental sustainability, new materials
such as carbon nanotubes can lead to lighter, more durable and more
environmentally friendly products in production. The integration of artificial
intelligence and robotics into production processes can increase the efficiency of the
workforce and lead to lower costs. In short, the sector will experience radical changes
in the next decade with digitalization and technological innovations.
15

a. Impact
The global, economic, environmental and social impacts of engineering solutions are quite
extensive, and these impacts were clearly seen in the activities and processes I observed
during my internship. The retail sector is one of the areas where we can directly observe the
impacts of engineering solutions, especially in logistics, category management and
production processes. Below, I will detail the impacts of these solutions in four main
dimensions.
Global Impact:
During my internship, I had the opportunity to observe how global trade is managed thanks
to FLO Group's wide access to international markets. In particular, logistics and supply chain
processes ensure that global trade is managed sustainably and efficiently. Engineering
solutions play an important role in improving and optimizing these processes. The faster,
more cost-effective and less resource-intensive transportation of products globally increases
the competitiveness of companies while also contributing to the development of global
trade. In these processes, global supply chain processes can be managed more effectively by
using software such as SAP and NOVA and data analysis techniques. In addition, engineering
solutions such as digitalization and automation allow for a faster and more flexible
production and distribution network to be established in global markets.
Economic Impact:
Engineering solutions are constantly developed to reduce companies' operational costs and
increase efficiency. During my internship, I observed how performance analyses and process
improvement studies contribute to the company's cost savings and increased profit margin.
For example, inventory costs can be minimized, and product sales performance can be
increased thanks to category management and stock optimization studies. Such engineering
solutions play an important role in terms of economic growth and sustainability. In addition,
making business processes more efficient using industrial engineering techniques provides a
competitive advantage in the market and contributes to the creation of an economically
sustainable structure. Cost optimization, efficient use of resources and process
improvements directly affect the company's overall economic performance.
Environmental Impact:
Engineering solutions also have a great impact in terms of environmental sustainability. FLO
Group's interest in sustainability projects shows that environmental awareness is increasing,
and the company is turning to environmentally friendly solutions. Energy efficiency-focused
solutions, especially used in logistics processes, aim to reduce the carbon footprint.
Engineering solutions such as determining energy-saving routes in product transportation
processes or using recyclable packaging materials contribute significantly to reducing
environmental impacts. At the same time, minimizing waste and increasing recycling rates
with the technologies used in production processes also contribute to environmental
sustainability. The role of industrial engineering in these processes is to optimize processes
to reduce environmental impacts and to develop environmentally friendly solutions.
16

Social Impact:
Engineering solutions also significantly affect social life. Since the retail sector serves a wide
customer base, the social impact of processes developed with engineering solutions is quite
large. The fact that products reach consumers at more affordable prices, faster and with
higher quality is a factor that directly affects living standards. In addition, transformations
are taking place in the labor market with the increase in digitalization and automation
processes. The improvements made by industrial engineers in processes reduce the
workload of employees and provide a more efficient and healthier working environment. At
the same time, thanks to these solutions, more efficient use of social resources is ensured
and social responsibility projects that provide feedback to society are supported.
As a result, the global, economic, environmental and

social impacts of the engineering
solutions I observed during my internship are quite comprehensive. These solutions not only
contribute to the profitability of the business, but also allow important steps to be taken for
a sustainable world. Engineering is key to positive change in many different areas, both
locally and globally, and these impacts will become even more pronounced in the future.
b. Teamwork
The teamwork I participated in and observed during my internship helped me understand
the importance of team spirit in the business world. I saw that different perspectives and
solutions were produced by working together with people from different areas of expertise
in projects in departments such as logistics, marketing and category management.
For example, I worked together with industrial engineers, finance experts, planning and
purchasing managers in the logistics department. While industrial engineers performed
process optimization, the finance team evaluated the economic aspects of decisions with
cost analyses. The planning and purchasing teams also ensured that the product flow went
smoothly. I also helped analyze stock management and

sales performance.
The division of labor and organization within the team was systematic, everyone was in
constant communication, knowing their responsibilities. This structure enabled projects to
be completed more efficiently and showed how effective teamwork is on success.
17

c. Self-directed Learning
My internship experience emphasized the importance of developing a positive attitude
towards continuous self-development and lifelong learning. During this process, I realized
that I needed to acquire additional knowledge, skills and attitudes for my professional
practice.
First, I realized that I needed more information on data analysis and reporting in order to
follow current trends in the sector. I thought that developments in e-commerce and digital
marketing should be followed. In this field, I believe that it would be useful to have
knowledge on topics such as big data analytics, customer segmentation and social media
marketing. In addition, developing my skills to communicate and collaborate effectively
within the team will help me take a more active role in teamwork.
I needed technical knowledge to be able to analyze and effectively execute my projects. For
example, I wanted to learn more about ERP systems (Enterprise Resource Planning) in order
to understand planning processes. Learning how these systems work would allow me to
manage projects more efficiently. In addition, learning more about topics such as marketing
strategies and customer relationship management would allow me to be more effective in
these processes.
I used various methods to collect the necessary information. First, the trainings and
presentations held in the company provided me with first-hand information on the subject.
In addition, I benefited from the experiences of experts in the departments by having one-
on-one interviews. In addition, I tried to reach up-to-date information by using online
resources and sectoral reports. Academic article

s and sectoral analyses, when combined
with the trainings I received, expanded my knowledge.
As a result, the experiences I gained during my internship contributed to me being more
conscious about self-development. Continuous learning and t

he desire to improve myself
are critical to advancing in my career and keeping up with the changes in the sector. During
this process, I decided to do more training and practice to put what I learned into practice.
In the future, I aim to increase my knowledge and skills and become a more competent
professional in the field of industrial engineering.
18

Appendix 1: Daily Activity Tables
On the first day of my internship, Recruitment and Career Group Manager Pınar Sancaklı
gave us a presentation and introduced FLO Group in detail. During the presentation, I
learned about the company's history, mission and vision. Ms. Pınar provided comprehensive
information about the general internship process, shared which departments we would
receive training in and the expected goals during the internship.
In addition, as interns, I was in a motivating environment with a warm welcome. The
sincerity and supportive attitudes of the team members left a positive impression about how
my internship would go. This start made me feel like I was taking a big step for my career
and made me excited about my journey at FLO Group.
On the second day of my internship, I got broad information on the e-commerce
organization of FLO. I was told that multi-channel sales strategies try to create customer
satisfaction both at the stores and online. In this respect, throughout my internship in the
category management area, I studied the operation processes such as the order process,
stock tracking, and analysis of product performances and documented my knowledge about
these subjects. I reviewed in detail the basic works of showing the products in a digital
environment, the planning of campaigns, and the analyses of digital performance within the
platform management.
20

On the third day of my internship, our team was given comprehensive training on planning
processes in the logistics department and how domestic-international product flows work.
During the training, I gained in-depth knowledge of the storage, distribution and supply
chain management processes of products.
We also conducted detailed analyses on case studies regarding the coordination of domestic
and international operations. I was impressed to see how these processes play a critical role
in terms of cost management and customer satisfaction.
On the fourth day of my internship, we took a closer look at IN STREET, one of the brands
within the Flo Group. We evaluated in detail the work carried out for this brand to reach its
targeted structure. We focused particularly on market positioning, target audience analysis
and competitive strategies. Thanks to the work we did, I had the opportunity to better
understand what steps the brand took to achieve its growth goals and what strategic
decisions were made. I realized how critical competition and market dynamics played a role
in the brand's success. This process allowed me to gain in-depth knowledge of marketing
and brand management and provided me with important experience in line with my career
goals.
21

Today, I was able to get very important information concerning how the General Directorate
of Marketing and Growth works. I knew how brand marketing takes part in the development
of strategies and communication plans according to the purposes of the company. Besides,
learning how budget management is determined by the consideration of campaign periods
helped me to understand the effectiveness of marketing processes. This experience has
taught me quite a lot that will guide me through my professional life.
The presentation on international sales in Flo Group was held on the sixth day of my
internship. During this presentation, areas of responsibilities of international sales
managers, target market determination, export process management, and customer
relations were discussed. Being part of such a presentation, I was really amazed by
understanding that Flo Group operates in so many countries and different markets. That
helped me to understand its current influence in international company markets and
strategic plans.
22

Today, I came to learn quite a lot about Supply Operations. To this effect, certain important
systems were talked about in detail, such as SAP. The explanation of the main elements of
the supply chain-from inventory management and supplier relations to demand forecasting
and cost control-finally followed. These studies would permit me to understand the critical
nature of data-based decision-making and performance improvement.
Moreover, studying how to enhance the operational efficiency of a company through the
effective management of the supply process was also very motivating for me. Such
information helped me to realize the complexity of supply operations and develop relevant
competencies for being more effective in the future.
Today, I got a chance to have great insight into the Finance department. We conducted
broad analyses of domestic and international net sales and regional sales performances.
Furthermore, there were discussions regarding how financial data is explored regionally and
how this data was feeding into the growth plans of the company. These processes' effects
on the company's overall strategy helped me understand the value of financial
management. The experience today helped me to understand more about how the finance
department functions in a business and the ability to achieve strategic goals through data
analysis.
23

Today, my training in the department was about Accessories and Category Management. In
this training, detailed information was received about the current trends of the sector,
analysis of competitors, and supplier collections, and how to create a collection suitable for
customer preferences in cooperation with the design team. We studied detailed subjects
like researching new materials, getting samples and price quotes from suppliers, examining
alternative suppliers. I was also actively involved in managing the processes, like sharing the
orders with suppliers, tracking shipment so that products can go into production.
Today, there was a presentation about the company's accessories and category
management. During my selection quantity control and consolidation study, I got product
selection quantities from all channels and learned about the transmission process to the
merchandising team. I learned the PSF strategy and developed projects based on the data I
received. Therefore, both my analytical thinking talent and understanding of the dynamics at
work in business processes have improved.
24

On the eleventh day of my internship, I focused on seasonal sales tracking. During the
training, I learned in detail how to analyze current season sales data and how to integrate
this data into business strategies.
We focused on various metrics and reporting methods used to evaluate sales performance. I
also learned about inventory management and the impact of customer feedback on sales
processes.
On the twelfth day of my internship, we focused on product and category management in
department training. During the training, important topics such as product life cycle, category
strategies and market analysis were discussed. I learned the effects of product management
on meeting customer demands and creating collections that meet market needs.
We also focused on how category management affects sales performance and its role in
providing competitive advantage. In the training, I gained practical information on how to
monitor and evaluate products with data analysis and reporting methods.
25

On the thirteenth day of my internship, we covered e-commerce business and process
development activity areas in our department training. During the training, I gained
comprehensive information about the dynamic structure of e-commerce and current trends
in the sector.
We focused on how to effectively manage e-commerce processes, customer experience
enhancement strategies and digital marketing methods. I also learned how to optimize e-

commerce platforms and how to monitor performance with data analysis methods.
On the fourteenth day of my internship, I had the opportunity to meet the Marketing and
Growth Department. I learned the critical role of this department in increasing the visibility
of the brand in the market and determining growth strategies. The department works
intensively to understand customer needs and develop marketing strategies accordingly by
conducting target audience analysis. I also saw that they carry out comprehensive projects in
areas such as campaign planning, social media management and digital marketing. This
process allowed me to evaluate innovations and growth opportunities in the field of
marketing, as well as gain important information on competitive analysis and brand
